Merge pull request #14 from WikiJourney/dev

Replaced Activities with Fragments, added Navigation Drawer

Signed-off-by: Thomas Gaudin <thomas.gaudin@centraliens-lille.org>
Merge branch 'master' of github.com:WikiJourney/wikijourney_app

First working implementation of WikiJourney API

The app is now able to get information about the POIs around the user, and display their name and the Wikipedia link on the map.

Signed-off-by: Thomas Gaudin <thomas.gaudin@centraliens-lille.org>

Upgraded to OSMBonusPack v5.3

Modified default values
Bugfix

Various fixes and improvements

Changed the layout, so it doesn't use 'magic numbers'.
Changed the way we pass parameters between fragments, no more 'parsing int to string to convert them back to int'.
Improved (a bit) error handling.

Signed-off-by: Thomas Gaudin <thomas.gaudin@centraliens-lille.org>

To be improved later...

Signed-off-by: Thomas Gaudin <thomas.gaudin@centraliens-lille.org>

Added custom bubble layout, to have a clean 'More info' arrow.

I also moved the POI markers to their own FolderOverlay to deal with clustering later.
But it weirdly stops the starter Marker to show its title...

Signed-off-by: Thomas Gaudin <thomas.gaudin@centraliens-lille.org>

Implemented (somehow) the Async task.

Now I need to completely refactor MapFragment.java, so we call functions when the download is done instead of having the whole logic in the main().

Signed-off-by: Thomas Gaudin <thomas.gaudin@centraliens-lille.org>

Upgrade to Android Studio 1.3

Signed-off-by: Thomas Gaudin <thomas.gaudin@centraliens-lille.org>

Cleanup of the code before refactoring.

I also got back to the InputStream read method of Android website, since it automatically handles GZIP data.

Signed-off-by: Thomas Gaudin <thomas.gaudin@centraliens-lille.org>

(Maybe) First refactoring for async network calls

This is still ugly, not commented, without any of the ideas of Java coding.
But it seems to work on my Galaxy S4 (miracle!!!).
Doesn't work on Genymotion though (tested with Android 5.1) :'(

Ah, and by the way, I think the functions/drawPOI.java is useless...

Signed-off-by: Thomas Gaudin <thomas.gaudin@centraliens-lille.org>

Bump to v0.0.2

Also updated support:design to 22.2.1

Signed-off-by: Thomas Gaudin <thomas.gaudin@centraliens-lille.org>

General refactoring and cleaning

Some functions were moved to their own file in functions package, now it is starting to look better (maybe not good, but better anyway).
I added Javadoc to some functions, I removed unused variables, imports, comments, code...

Signed-off-by: Thomas Gaudin <thomas.gaudin@centraliens-lille.org>

Disabled ProGuard for release version, since it doesn't work out of the box.

We will have to dig a little deeper to configure it, and make it work.
I also changed the module name to wikijourney, to match the project :p

Signed-off-by: Thomas Gaudin <thomas.gaudin@centraliens-lille.org>

Emergency fix

Nothing worked, no build, no Gradle... I untracked a required file, which disappeared after the change of module name...
So this reverts a change in the commit 85aa99894e0b3423544e9480ee03be6601c8dfd9
